<s>The<\s> Gneiss and Mica Schists are not equally con-

complicated where the inclination of the folia

the foliation is perpendicular it usually follows
true planes without any distortion either on the
dip or strike. The Granitic varieties of Gneiss
in which the foliation is slightly marked are,
I believe, more common where the angle of incli-
nation is slight, & the separation of the minerals
is usually well marked where the Gneiss is either
perpendicular or highly inclined. Thus observations
taken where the foliation is perpendicular admit
of much greater accuracy than can be obtained
where it is slightly inclined.
